To analyze the transformation from left to right:

- First, I observe the object in the left picture. It appears to be some sort of object with a pattern on it.
- Next, I examine the object in the right picture. It retains the same general shape and pattern, indicating that it is indeed the same type of object as seen in the left picture.
- Comparing the sizes of the objects in both pictures, it is evident that the object in the right picture is smaller than the object in the left picture.

From this step-by-step analysis, I conclude that the transformation rule that applies here is that objects become smaller from left to right. Therefore, the correct rule describing the transformation is (1) Objects become smaller.
